title: "Ensuring Lawful Governance" EO (Environmental Protection Agency)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: "Ensuring Lawful Governance" EO (Environmental Protection Agency)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

The February 19 executive order  “Ensuring Lawful Governance and Implementing the President’s “Department of Government Efficiency” Deregulatory Initiative” (EO 14219) states: “Within 60 days of the date of this order, agency heads shall provide to the Administrator of the Office of Information and Regulatory Affairs (OIRA) within the Office of Management and Budget a list of all regulations identified by class as listed in subsection (a) of this section.”

https://www.federalregister.gov/documents/2025/02/25/2025-03138/ensuring-lawful-governance-and-implementing-the-presidents-department-of-government-efficiency

I am requesting the memo or reports created in response to this order, including any media and attachments sent from the Environmental Protection Agency to OIRA.

I am a member of the press, and the documents will be used in the course of reporting for Chemical Watch News & Insight (https://www.enhesa.com/product-intelligence/our-solutions/chemical-watch-news-insight/).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Meg Duff

title: Police disciplinary files (Skamania County Prosecuting Attorney)

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Police disciplinary files (Skamania County Prosecuting Attorney)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

- Any and all lists, spreadsheets or other organized datasets that detail potential or substantiated allegations of misconduct and/or impeached or impeachable testimony, created under Brady v. Maryland and/or Giglio v. United States.
- Any and all records regarding substantiated allegations of misconduct or violations of internal department policy or criminal law by specific law enforcement officers.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Moe Clark

communications.subject: County Public Records Request :: C003439-071325
communications.communication:
Dear Moe Clark: 
Thank you for your interest in public records of Skamania County. Your request has been received and is being processed in accordance with the State of Washington Public Records Act, Chapter 42.56 RCW and Skamania County Ordinance 2020-04 (Skamania County Code Chapter 2.72). Your request was received in this office on 7/13/2025 and given the reference number C003439-071325 for tracking purposes.  Records Requested: To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

- Any and all lists, spreadsheets or other organized datasets that detail potential or substantiated allegations of misconduct and/or impeached or impeachable testimony, created under Brady v. Maryland and/or Giglio v. United States.
- Any and all records regarding substantiated allegations of misconduct or violations of internal department policy or criminal law by specific law enforcement officers.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Moe Clark

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fskamania-county-prosecuting-attorney-35809%252Fpolice-disciplinary-files-skamania-county-prosecuting-attorney-189448%252F%253Femail%253Dkick%252540co.skamania.wa.us&url_auth_token=AAGxh5FjosFuz2fYFEOMLlnPKTQ%3A1ubA51%3AE0hbqq6XlYrDazZaGzJ004O_QcHqLsPyB6OgKyqBMZ4 
 
Your request will be forwarded to the relevant department(s) to interpret and determine the size and complexity of your request, and to locate the records you seek. Within five (5) business days, you will receive a response confirming
receipt of your request. At that time, you will be provided with an
estimated date when requested records will be ready for release, a
request for clarification/additional information that will aid us in
locating/identifying records that may be responsive to your request, or
the record(s) will be released to you. 
 
PLEASE NOTE: The State of Washington Public Records Act, Chapter 42.56 RCW, does not require a governmental body to create new information, to do legal research, or to answer questions. 
 
You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below. You will receive an email when your request has been completed. 
 
It will also explain the costs associated with fulfilling your request, if any.  Again, thank you for using the Public Records Center. 
 
SKAMANIA COUNTY PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST

memorandum_regarding_potential_impeachment_information_SCSO_Ryan_Taylor_signed.pdf (https://u8387778.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=u001.VEsWrlMiJDg0mXafq1mEXXKNHMGZjOd7qdQtHPrqDUSnThnOAjge8ztdyL9xIcfHcJ-2FbxPyhrYsO296qCMQ4krAFnZjDKM6-2F6SwxLHryn8yletkr79kYHkWwuI4xCetK7MdTiJaipmOfwwLJZ-2F99oeuJ5GlP-2F50t5vLjFO2-2BcEEMHUkG-2BNsgcH6KWJ8u-2BhtPQEZXX66JSFelXZuzVDF6TQ-3D-3DJkmW_i7PPmdQSnEIMQYRPjqkxSMkKALps7Pk-2F44enR0PR-2BIIFoeVqPQi31-2F7NuV2WGCoRNEOPi-2BurTvIioBhOWA78EULvjiXo0T1I5nky-2FjqG855YkiACuAlK6S5imON4MLay-2F9XVb-2F0PqYDQ2HVZYsyWOCjkwOXIdWf8Eq42WBdYFXH1BiQG-2Fk7qtPqO3J5QzUt8zV9iMk6cC80jEpdXsmDyzUZmClOsIFBP5NAAwpOVlTmvm3RdngHBX5ZRL3-2BrATGNU-2FboGY5S2t4xMXJXS8nglmsb8Wvt5VIGhLcMMcxIlXIh0DzLjG-2BV-2FLakhpI1-2BwCgyh-2BZzaxZugZZrrfmZFJMx5324gRs4jloRVu5OMEFZn7MDJE-2FaF-2FzP-2FP-2Bbi8rQ7dlxD0LDVxCTRn-2BAkk5YlTfBA-3D-3D) 

--- Please respond above this line --- 
RE: PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST of July 13, 2025, Reference #C003439-071325 Dear Mr. Clark: Greetings. My name is Joseph Anderson and I am a Deputy Public Records Officer for Skamania County. I assist inreviewing and responding to public records requests (PRRs) for alldepartments. 

On July 13, 2025, we received your public records request for "- Any and all lists, spreadsheets or other organized datasets that detail potential or substantiated allegations of misconduct and/or impeached or impeachable testimony, created under Brady v. Maryland and/or Giglio v. United States. 
- Any and all records regarding substantiated allegations of misconduct or violations of internal department policy or criminal law by specific law enforcement officers. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes." 
After reviewing our files, we have located records that are responsive to your request. Please log in to the Skamania County Public Records Center at the following link to retrieve the records responsive to your request: County Public Records Request - C003439-071325 Pleasenote the following information from Skamania County Prosecutor AdamKick with respect to the first part of your request, as writtenabove, regarding Brady or Giglio material: "[Skamania County does not] have a 'Brady list,' per se.There is one deputy that works for the Skamania county Sheriff’s Officefor whom we have potential impeachment information and for whom weprovide a memo summarizing the circumstances. We provide this memo whenrequired to defense counsel on cases involving this deputy. Becausethere is only one local deputy for whom we maintain PID information,there is no list. Just the single memo, which we are happy to provide. [ Potential Impeachment Disclosure memo attached here .] TheWashington State Patrol sometimes sends us information from state-widepotential impeachment issues with WSP employees. We do not maintain thisinformation in any organized way because it does not apply to anyofficers that regularly appear in our courts/cases. I just want toconfirm that these records are not made into any list, and to the extentthat these records are related to WSP employees, are likely bettersought from the WSP directly, if you’re interested in the raw data (inaddition to any lists)." I have been advised by the Sheriff's Office that there are no records responsive to the second portion of your request seeking records regarding substantiated allegations of misconduct or violations of internaldepartment policy or criminal law by specific law enforcement officers. SkamaniaCounty has searched for, attempted to identify, locate, and provide anynon-exempt public records that may be responsive to this request. Since this completely fulfills your request, we are now closing this public records request. The one (1) yearstatute of limitations to seek judicial review under the Public RecordsAct (Chapter 42.56 RCW) begins now because Skamania County does notintend to further address this request. Please note that if you do not review and download your records within thirty (30) days, they may be removed from the system, in which case you will have to start the public records process all over again to receive your requested records. 

Please feel free to contact me if you have any further questions or concerns by replying to this email or at my phone number below. 

Sincerely, 

Joseph Anderson 
Deputy Public Records Officer 
Office of the Skamania County Prosecuting Attorney 
240 NW Vancouver Avenue | PO Box 790 
Stevenson, WA 98648 
509-427-3791

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request #R000657-070125
communications.communication:
Hello,

Thank you for sending over you all's Brady List and for navigating the email situation. I really appreciate your time and effort.

I wanted to ask if you all maintain any records in regards to the law enforcement officers that show why they were placed on the list. For example, misconduct violations, internal policy violations, instances of dishonesty, etc. I also included this request in my initial request.

Thank you again for your time. Let me know if you have any questions.

Best,
Aspen Ford

communications.subject: New Message :: R000657-070125
communications.communication:

RE: Public Records Request of July 01, 2025, Reference # R000657-070125 Hi, Aspen, In response to your most recent relpy, we have added PID Letters to the attachments. These letters explain why each Officer has been placed on the Brady List. 
Please log in to the Public Records Center at the following link to retrieve the responsive records. Public Records Request - R000657-070125 For questions or additional information, please reply to this email. Sincerely, Rick Gregory

title: Texas universities: Past and planned student events (University of Texas at San Antonio)

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Texas universities: Past and planned student events (University of Texas at San Antonio)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

This is a survey of events planned or proposed by recognized or registered student organizations (or individual students or faculty members). I am seeking copies of calendar entries for events that were held or proposed. I am not seeking a search of records held by students or student organizations. I am only seeking information held by the university administration (for example, in an Event Management System, which may be helpful in providing a list of past events and proposed future events). 

If this request is unclear or if I could clarify it in any way, please don't hesitate to ask.

I request:

1. All calendar entries (or Event Management System database entries) for events held or sponsored by a registered student organization, individual student, or faculty member during the final two weeks of each term during 2023, 2024, and Winter/Spring 2025. If your institution's academic calendar does not identify a final date of a given term, please use the final day of exams for the term as the final day of the term.

2. All calendar entries (or Event Management System database entries) for events held or sponsored by a registered student organization, individual student, or faculty member after 10:00 p.m. and/or before 8:00 a.m., between January 31, 2023 and July 1, 2025.

3. All calendar entries for events which are or were proposed to be held by a registered student organization, individual student, or faculty member, where the event is proposed to be held after 10:00 p.m. and/or before 8:00 a.m. This request is limited to events that are proposed to be held between July 1, 2025 and July 1, 2026. 

4. All calendar entries for events which are or were proposed to be held by a registered student organization, individual student, or faculty member, where the event is proposed to be during the final two weeks of a term in the Fall 2025, Winter 2025-2026, or Spring 2026 semesters/terms. Please us the same means of calculating "final two weeks" as in (1), above.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

communications.subject: Welcome to the UTSA Open Records Center
communications.communication:
Dear Adam  Steinbaugh, 
Thank you for registering in the UTSA Open Records Center. You may check the status of any request that you submitted at any time by clicking on the link below: Click here to login (https://www.utsa.edu/openrecords/publicportal.html)

communications.subject: UTSA Open Records Request :: W009944-063025
communications.communication:
Dear Adam  Steinbaugh, 
The University of Texas at San Antonio Open Records Office has received your Texas Public Information Act request and assigned it reference number W009944-063025. 
 
Your request will be forwarded to the relevant UTSA offices/departments to locate responsive documents and to determine the volume and any costs associated with satisfying your request. We will contact you with any questions and/or when your requested documents are ready to be released. PLEASE NOTE: The Texas Public Information Act does not require a governmental body to create new information, to do legal research, or to answer questions. 
You can monitor the progress of your request through UTSA's Open Records tracking system at the link below, and you will receive an email when your request has been completed. 
Sincerely, 
UTSA Open Records Office 
www.utsa.edu/openrecords 
 
 

 
**Please do not reply directly to this email.** 
This email address is not checked for incoming mail.

communications.subject: UTSA Open Records Request Updated :: W009944-063025
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 
I write to advise you we will need additional time to produce the information for release . UTSA will make this information available to you on or before Friday, July 25th at 5:00 pm. See TEX. GOV’T CODE §§ 552.221, 552.2615. If you have questions or wish to discuss this further, you may contact me at 210-458-7500 or email at publicinfo@utsa.edu Thank you, Kathleen Blanton UTSA Open Records Manager

2. All calendar entries (or Event Management System database entries) for events held or sponsored by a registered student organization, individual student, or faculty member after 10:00 p.m. and/or before 8:00 a.m., between January 31, 2023 and July 1, 2025. 

3. All calendar entries for events which are or were proposed to be held by a registered student organization, individual student, or faculty member, where the event is proposed to be held after 10:00 p.m. and/or before 8:00 a.m. This request is limited to events that are proposed to be held between July 1, 2025 and July 1, 2026. 

4. All calendar entries for events which are or were proposed to be held by a registered student organization, individual student, or faculty member, where the event is proposed to be during the final two weeks of a term in the Fall 2025, Winter 2025-2026, or Spring 2026 semesters/terms. Please us the same means of calculating "final two weeks" as in (1), above. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Adam Steinbaugh 
We have reviewed our files and located the attached documents that are responsive to your request.  Although the TPIA allows a governmental body to charge for copying documents, the attached is provided to you at no charge. 
If you have any questions or wish to discuss this further, you may contact me at 210-458-7500 / 210-458-4105 or via email at publicinfo@utsa.edu. 

Sincerely, Kathleen Blanton Open Records Manager 
The University of Texas at San Antonio 
Office of Legal Affairs - Open Records 
www.utsa.edu/openrecords **If you wish to make or amend an open records request to UTSA you may do so online at www.utsa.edu/openrecords.**

title: ChatGPT EDU user analytics data

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: ChatGPT EDU user analytics data
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1) A user data export from the university's ChatGPT EDU user analytics dashboard covering the time period January 1, 2025 until the date this request is processed. A description of this data and how to export it from the dashboard are available here: https://help.openai.com/en/articles/10875114-user-analytics-for-chatgpt-enterprise-and-edu. 

Specifically, I am requesting the data export report described in that help article under the heading "User export - column definitions". Several of the data columns in the export ("name" and "email") contain personally identifiable information and I acknowledge that these columns must be redacted or removed from the responsive record.

2) A GPT data export from the university's ChatGPT EDU user analytics dashboard covering the time period January 1, 2025 until the date this request is processed. Specifically, I am requesting the data export report described in the help article linked above under the heading "GPT export - column definitions." I acknowledge that this report contains one data column ("gpt_creator_email") that must be redacted or removed from the responsive record.

I ask that the responsive records be provided as .csv files or in a comparable, data-friendly file type.

I also ask that all fees be waived as the records I have requested are readily available and can be instantly exported from the user analytics dashboard. The necessary redactions can also be done quickly and in mass by removing the relevant columns from the dataset.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Todd Feathers

title: Dolores Leschuck Open Records Request

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Dolores Leschuck Open Records Request
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Dear Sir or Madam:

I am submitting this letter in order to request all documents, public information and public records related to Case ID 25000541, described below.  Please be advised that this request is hereby submitted pursuant to The Texas Open Records Act, Texas Government Code Chapter 552, and The Federal Freedom of Information Act.  I would like to request that all such public information and records be produced as soon as possible.  Please be advised that your agency will be paid the requisite fees, in accordance with the Open Records Act, with respect to your compliance with this request for the production of public records and documents.

Our office represents Dolores Leschuck in regard to injuries she sustained in an automobile accident  on April 9, 2025 at approximately 5:48 PM.  The location of the accident was 21100 SE H.K. Dodgen Loop, Temple TX.  The public information and documents which I am requesting at this time (including information that is collected, assembled, or maintained under a law or ordinance or in connection with the transaction of official business by or for a government body, which included the media on which the public information is recorded, paper, film, magnetic, optical, and/or solid state device that can store an electronic signal; tape; computer disk; etc.) are as follows:

•	Any video or photographs taken at the scene of the collision, or in the officer’s cruiser,
 
•	Any bodycam footage captured by responding officers,

•	Any witness statements, handwritten notes, or supplemental accident report information, 

•	An audio copy of the 911 calls from witnesses who called in to report this accident, along with any witness names, addresses, and phone numbers that may be in possession of the communications center, along with any police reports that correspond to this particular incident. 

•	Copies of all sketches, diagrams, witness statements and/or names and phone numbers of witnesses at the scene who did not give statements that may be in the possession of your department.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Vic Feazell

These may also be listed as "Violation of Visitor Protocol" letters. Please note that I am not seeking any personally identifiable information or otherwise exempt information. Because this request is in the public interest for Illinois nonprofit The FOIA Bakery’s work to advocate for public education, please waive any fees in accordance with 5 ILCS § 140/6(c). The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Miriam Bhimani

Chicago Public Schools (CPS) responds to all public records requests in accordance with the Illinois Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), 5 ILCS 140/1 et seq. 
Due to the volume and complexity of requests received in the normal course of business, CPS is extending the time for its initial response to your request by an additional 5 business days (to 10 business days total beginning on the first business day following receipt of the request) pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/3(e)(v) which allows for the examination and evaluation of the requested records by personnel to determine if they are exempt from disclosure under Section 7 of Illinois FOIA or should be revealed only with appropriate deletions. 
Upon the completion of a response, CPS will provide the first 50 pages to you at no charge.  If a response is more than 50 pages, a fee of 15¢ per page will be charged for each additional page. Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fchicago-public-schools-3121%252Fn6-parent-restriction-letters-188439%252F%253F&url_auth_token=AAATZ164Jy60iQjs6iHTUOyYGcc%3A1uUdI5%3AzvJvoxk9V05s9HIuzvTzU9F8deZmqXeNlZkASfmSBeg RESPONSE: T he letters that the FOIA Office was able to locate are available to download via the CPS FOIA Center at www.cps.edu/FOIARequests . Please log in with your username and password to access the records. Please be advised that parent/guardian information was redacted pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/7.5 (r) which exempts from inspection or copying information prohibited from being disclosed by the Illinois School Student Records Act (ISSRA). ISSRA generally prohibits the disclosure of “school student records” and defines a “school student record” as “any writing or other recorded information concerning a student and by which a student may be individually identified, maintained by a school or at is direction or by an employee of a school, regardless of how or where the information is stored.” (105 ILCS 10/2(d). 
Section 7(1)(c) exempts personal information contained within public records, the disclosure of which would constitute a clearly unwarranted invasion of personal privacy, unless the disclosure is consented to in writing by the individual subject of the information. “Unwarranted invasion of personal privacy” means the disclosure of information that is highly personal or objectionable to a reasonable person and in which the subject’s right to privacy outweighs any legitimate public interest in obtaining the information. You have a right to have the denial of your request reviewed by the Public Access Counselor (PAC) at the Office of the Illinois Attorney General. 5 ILCS 140/9.5(a). You can file your Request for Review with the PAC by writing to: Leah Bartelt; Public Access Counselor Office of the Attorney General 500 South 2nd Street Springfield, Illinois 62706 E-mail: public.access@ilag.gov 877-299-3642 You also have the right to seek judicial review of your denial by filing a lawsuit in the State circuit court. 5 ILCS 140/11. If you choose to file a Request for Review with the PAC, you must do so within 60 calendar days of the date of this denial letter. 5 ILCS 140/9.5(a). Please note that you must include a copy of your original FOIA request and this denial letter when filing a Request for Review with the PAC. Sincerely, Patricia Majchrowicz Freedom of Information Act Officer Chicago Public Schools

title: transgender deportations

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: transgender deportations
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Data regarding how many transgender people have been removed from the United States. The date range I'm looking for is 2010-2020. I want to know what states or territories they were picked up in, what facilities they were held in for how long, and what countries they were deported to. Did any of them die while in ERO custody/control?  Please make this data available as soon as possible. Thank you for your help.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Adam Allen

communications.subject: ICE FOIA Request 2021-ICFO-35157
communications.communication:
May 18, 2021 Adam Allen MuckRock News DEPT MR 111716 411A Highland Ave Somerville, MA 02144 RE:     ICE FOIA Case Number 2021-ICFO-35157  Dear Mr. Allen: This acknowledges receipt of your April 28, 2021, Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request to U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE), for data regarding how many transgender people have been removed from the United States from 2010-2020 including the states or territories they were picked up in, what facilities they were held in and for how long, and what countries they were deported to.  Your request was received in this office on April 28, 2021. Due to the increasing number of FOIA requests received by this office, we may encounter some delay in processing your request. Per Section 5.5(a) of the DHS FOIA regulations, 6 C.F.R. Part 5, ICE processes FOIA requests according to their order of receipt. Although ICE’s goal is to respond within 20 business days of receipt of your request, the FOIA does permit a 10- day extension of this time period. As your request seeks numerous documents that will necessitate a thorough and wide-ranging search, ICE will invoke a 10-day extension for your request, as allowed by Title 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(6)(B). If you care to narrow the scope of your request, please contact our office. We will make every effort to comply with your request in a timely manner. Provisions of the FOIA allow us to recover part of the cost of complying with your request.  We shall charge you for records in accordance with the DHS Interim FOIA regulations, as they apply to media requesters.  As a media requester, you will be charged 10 cents per page for duplication; the first 100 pages are free.  We will construe the submission of your request as an agreement to pay up to $25.00. You will be contacted before any further fees are accrued. We have queried the appropriate program offices within ICE for responsive records. If any responsive records are located, they will be reviewed for determination of releasability. Please be assured that one of the processors in our office will respond to your request as expeditiously as possible. We appreciate your patience as we proceed with your request. 
Your request has been assigned reference number 2021-ICFO-35157. Please refer to this identifier in any future correspondence. To check the status of an ICE FOIA/PA request, please visit . Please note that to check the status of a request, you must enter the 2021-ICFO-35157 tracking number. If you need any further assistance or would like to discuss any aspect of your request, please contact the FOIA office. You may send an e-mail to ice-foia@ice.dhs.gov, call toll free (866) 633-1182, or you may contact our FOIA Public Liaison, Fernando Pineiro, in the same manner. Additionally, you have a right to right to seek dispute resolution services from the Office of Government Information Services (OGIS) which mediates disputes between FOIA requesters and Federal agencies as a non-exclusive alternative to litigation. If you are requesting access to your own records (which is considered a Privacy Act request), you should know that OGIS does not have the authority to handle requests made under the Privacy Act of 1974. You may contact OGIS as follows: Office of Government Information Services, National Archives and Records Administration, 8601 Adelphi Road-OGIS, College Park, Maryland 20740-6001, e-mail at ogis@nara.gov; telephone at 202-741-5770; toll free at 1-877-684-6448; or facsimile at 202-741-5769. (http://www.dhs.gov/foia-status) http://www.dhs.gov/foia-status
Regards, 

ICE FOIA Office 
Immigration and Customs Enforcement 
Freedom of Information Act Office 
500 12th Street, S.W., Stop 5009 
Washington, D.C. 20536-5009 
Telephone: 1-866-633-1182 
Visit our FOIA website at www.ice.gov/foia

communications.communication: Hi: I lost the password for this request. Can you send a new one please? Thank you

communications.subject: ICE FOIA 2021-ICFO-35157
communications.communication:
07/25/2025 

Adam Allen 
DEPT MR 111716 
Somerville, Massachusetts 02144 

RE:	ICE FOIA 2021-ICFO-35157 
 
Dear Requester: 

This email is in response to your status inquiry regarding ICE FOIA 2021-ICFO-35157, in which you have requested requesting data regarding how many transgender people have been removed from the United States from 2010-2020 including the states or territories they were picked up in, what facilities they were held in and for how long, and what countries they were deported to. 

This request is closed. ICE's final response was sent on 9/30/2024. 

ICE FOIA apologizes for the delay in the processing of your request. Please be assured that one of the processors in our office will respond to your request as expeditiously as possible. We appreciate your patience as we proceed with your request. 

If you have any questions, please contact FOIA Public Liaison, Daniel Edgington at the address above or (866) 633-1182. Additionally, you have a right to seek dispute resolution services from the Office of Government Information Services (OGIS) which mediates disputes between FOIA requesters and Federal agencies as a non-exclusive alternative to litigation.  If you are requesting access to your own records (which is considered a Privacy Act request), you should know that OGIS does not have the authority to handle requests made under the Privacy Act of 1974.  You may contact OGIS as follows:  Office of Government Information Services, National Archives and Records Administration, 8601 Adelphi Road-OGIS, College Park, Maryland 20740-6001, e-mail at ogis@nara.gov; telephone at 202-741-5770; toll free at 1-877-684-6448. 

Your request has been assigned reference number 2021-ICFO-35157. Please use this number in future correspondence. 

Sincerely, 

ICE FOIA Office 
Immigration and Customs Enforcement 
Freedom of Information Act Office 
500 12th Street, S.W., Stop 5009

title: Police disciplinary files (Pierce County Prosecuting Attorney)

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Police disciplinary files (Pierce County Prosecuting Attorney)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

- Any and all lists, spreadsheets or other organized datasets that detail potential or substantiated allegations of misconduct and/or impeached or impeachable testimony, created under Brady v. Maryland and/or Giglio v. United States.
- Any and all records regarding substantiated allegations of misconduct or violations of internal department policy or criminal law by specific law enforcement officers.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Moe Clark

title: Public Records Request: ShotSpotter

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Public Records Request: ShotSpotter
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

According to a story published on August 18, the Tacoma Police Department received a $800,000 grant from the Department of Justice's Bureau of Justice Assistance to pilot the use of ShotSpotter.

Source: https://www.thenewstribune.com/news/local/crime/article291124000.html

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

- All contracts, licenses, MOUs, MOAs, data agreements, letters of intent, State of Work documents, Scope of Work documents, and other agreement documents with SoundThinking or ShotSpotter that were active any time between 1/1/2023 and the date this request is fulfilled.
- All financial documents or records of financial transactions, exchanges or obligations related to SoundThinking or ShotSpotter. Responsive materials include all invoices, bills, receipts, check stubs, or any other records, including those possessed in an electronic format.
- A copy of all training materials, including but not limited to any handouts, workbooks, assessments, presentations, slides, videos, audio files, or other materials, either developed in-house or provided to the agency pertaining to the agency's use of SoundThinking products.
- A copy of all agency manuals either developed in-house or provided to the agency pertaining to the agency's use of SoundThinking products.
- A copy of all agency policies and procedures either developed in-house or provided to the agency pertaining to the agency's use of SoundThinking products.
- A roster of all agency employees who either had or currently have a user account for SoundThinking products or had or currently have internal agency permissions to use SoundThinking products any time between 8/18/2024 and the date this request is fulfilled.
- A roster of all agency employees who have completed agency training for the use of SoundThinking products any time between 8/18/2024 and the date this request is fulfilled.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

e

communications.subject: Welcome to the City of Tacoma's Public Records Center!
communications.communication:
Dear e e, 
 
Thank you for registering with the City of Tacoma's Public Records Center! 
 
Your Login ID is:  183544-10381874@requests.muckrock.com 
 
If you did not submit your request through the public portal but are receiving this e-mail, an account has been created for you where you can track and monitor the status of your request, and receive any documents in response to your request. 
 
 
If you have never used this system or cannot remember your password you may request a temporary password here: Request Temporary Password (https://tacoma.mycusthelp.com/WEBAPP/_rs/ForgotPassword.aspx) 
 
Please login to "My Request Center" to update your account information, track the status of your request and receive requested records when they become available. 
 
City of Tacoma This is an auto-generated email and has originated from an unmonitored email account. Please DO NOT REPLY

title: Police disciplinary files (Pacific County Prosecuting Attorney)

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Police disciplinary files (Pacific County Prosecuting Attorney)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

- Any and all lists, spreadsheets or other organized datasets that detail potential or substantiated allegations of misconduct and/or impeached or impeachable testimony, created under Brady v. Maryland and/or Giglio v. United States.
- Any and all records regarding substantiated allegations of misconduct or violations of internal department policy or criminal law by specific law enforcement officers.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Moe Clark

title: Luis Echeverria Alvarez files (Federal Bureau of Investigation)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Luis Echeverria Alvarez files (Federal Bureau of Investigation)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

To Whom It May Concern:

This is a request under the Freedom of Information Act. I hereby request the following records:

A copy of FBI and CIA files on Luis Echeverría Álvarez, former president of Mexico, whose death was widely reported in the media on July 8, 2022.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage.

In the event that fees cannot be waived, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Hiroshi Takahashi

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Sincerely,

    of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the
    request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM
    if not.
    
    Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look
    forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days,
    as the statute requires.
    
    Sincerely,
    
    Hiroshi Takahashi
    
    Upload documents directly:
    https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Ffederal-bureau-of-investigation-10%252Fluis-echeverria-alvarez-files-federal-bureau-of-investigation-131708%252F%253Femail%253Defoia%252540subscriptions.fbi.gov&url_auth_token=AAAj2OUyZW-3jnbyK8lotyHikw8%3A1oE02u%3A8xmiVoJMVQxNDLZTs_ssfYP1ZfkHGp0MotpVQiTWbUA

Supporting documentation **

Please be advised that efoia@subscriptions.fbi.gov is a no-reply email
address. Questions regarding your FOIA request may be directed to
foipaquestions@fbi.gov. If you have received a FOIPA request number, please
include this in all correspondence concerning your request. Please note eFOIPA
requests are processed in the order that they are received. If you have not
received a FOIPA request number, your request is in the process of being
opened at which time it will be assigned a FOIPA request number and
correspondence will be forthcoming.

** 

Upon receipt of your FOIPA request number, you may check the status of your
FOIPA request on the FBIâ€™s electronic FOIA Library (The Vault) on the FBIâ€™s
public website, http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on the â€˜Check Status of Your
FOI/PA Request toolâ€™ link. Status updates are performed on a weekly basis. If
you receive a comment that your FOIPA request number was not located in the
database, please check back at a later date.

communications.subject: RE: [EXTERNAL EMAIL] -  RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #1553712-000
communications.communication:
Thank you for contacting foipaquestions@fbi.gov.  Please check the status of your FOIPA Request at http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on “Check Status of Your FOI/PA Request” on the right side of the page, and follow the instructions below.

Check the Status of Your FOIPA Request
If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-0] please enter [1234567-000] into the system. If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-1] please enter [1234567-001] into the system. If you have any questions about the status of your FOIPA request, please e-mail foipaquestions@fbi.gov.

FIND STATUS OF FOIPA- Request statuses are updated weekly

Please enter the whole FOIPA number-Example: [1234567-000]

FOIPA:
Results will show the Request Number, Case Type and Process Description shown below:
FOIPA:
1234567-000

Case Type:
FOIPA

Process Description (Will display the current progress of the request)
The FBI’s FOIPA Program is searching the FBI’s indices for potentially responsive documents.
You may be contacted via formal letter for all fees and/or negotiation issues that may apply.

NOTE: Recent requests are entered into the FOIPA database in the order that they are received. Before you can check the status, you must have received correspondence assigning a FOIPA request number and the information transferred to the online database. Status information is updated weekly. If a request has been closed within the last six months the online database will display the following: The FOIPA number entered has been closed, and appropriate correspondence has been sent to the address on file.

Estimated Dates of Completion
Requests are processed in the order in which they are received through our multi-track processing system.  Requests are divided into two primary tracks--simple (under 50 pages of potentially responsive documents) and complex (over 50 pages of potentially responsive documents).  Complex requests are further divided into medium, large, and extra-large sub-tracks based upon request size.  Simple track requests typically require the least amount of time to process.  Currently, simple track cases average approximately 98 days from the date of receipt for processing.  Our complex requests in the medium processing track are currently averaging 947 days, large processing track are currently averaging approximately 2,011 days, and extra-large processing track are currently averaging 2,360 days for processing.

Respectfully,

Public Information Officer
FBI - Information Management Division
200 Constitution Drive
Winchester, VA  22602
O: (540) 868-4593
E: foipaquestions@fbi.gov<mailto:foipaquestions@fbi.gov>

Do you have further questions about the FOI/PA process? Visit us at http://www.fbi.gov/foia

Please check the status of your request online at https://vault.fbi.gov/fdps-1/@@search-fdps    Status updates are performed on a weekly basis.

Note:  This is a non-emergency email address.  If this is an emergency, please call 911 directly.  If you need to report a tip for immediate action, please contact FBI Tips at http://tips.fbi.gov/ or reach out to your local field office.

communications.subject: Final Response Letter for FOIA Request
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Takahashi, I hope this message finds you well. ATF completed the processing of your FOIA request (referred from the FBI #1553712-000) for direct release to you), reference number 2025-REF-00043. Please find the enclosed final decision letter detailing the outcome and any applicable next steps. If you have any questions or require further clarification, please direct all additional correspondence through the ATFFOIAXpress PAL portal’s correspondence feature to contact our office. You canaccess the portal by creating an account at https://foia-pal.atf.gov. We appreciate your cooperation throughout this process. 
Sincerely, 

ATF FOIA Team 
Note: This is not a monitored mailbox and replies to thisemail will not be seen or responded to. If you have any questions or concerns,please use the ATF FOIAXpress PAL portal’s correspondence feature to contactour office. You can access the portal by creating an account athttps://foia-pal.atf.gov. Additionally, you can contact the FOIA PublicLiaisons at 202-648-7390 for any further assistance and to discuss anyaspect of your request. For technical issue with PAL, please email foia-pal-support@atf.gov.Thank you for your understanding

communications.subject: Delaware Freedom of Information Act Request: FOIA Request for Information
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Delaware Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

We are requesting a printed or electronic copy of all responses submitted for STATE OF DELAWARE Department of Education Request for Proposals for Professional Services Early Childhood Program Quality and Professional Registry Data System Issued by Delaware Department of Education on February 19, 2024.

CONTRACT NUMBER DOE2024-06

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jonathan Rudenberg, a citizen of Delaware, in coordination with Jill Soto.

communications.communication: I am writing to advise you that your request requires legal advice that will take more time for response than the typical 15 business days. The department’s good faith estimate is that we will have a response for you by July 21, 2025.

Angela"

title: Academic Dishonesty Study (Texas Tech University)

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Academic Dishonesty Study (Texas Tech University)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I would like a spreadsheet containing all the academic dishonesty reports from the beginning of the Fall 2021 semester to the end of the Spring 2025 Semester, organized by university college.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Anonymous

communications.subject: Re: Texas Public Information Act Request: Academic Dishonesty Study (Texas Tech University)
communications.communication:
Good Afternoon,

Texas Tech University System (TTUS) is in receipt of your Texas Public Information Act request, attached herein and contained in the email below.  However, TTUS seeks to discuss with you how the scope of your request might be narrowed and/or clarified pursuant to Texas Government Code § 552.222(b).  TTUS requests that you narrow or clarify the scope of your request as follows:

  1.
Your request seems to be for ALL the academic dishonesty reports from the beginning of the Fall 2021 semester to the end of the Spring 2025 Semester.  Currently, the information requested is unclear and may contain protected information, as many reports may contain personally identifiable information about students, which is confidential by federal and state law. Further, the gathering and required redactions of all of these documents may result in significant costs to you.  Narrowing your request to specific reports (i.e. statistics or final disposition letters) may allow us to clearly identify the information you seek more effectively and, potentially, at a lower cost.
  2.
In addition, Texas Tech University has over 40,000 students, so a request for all disposition letters over a five-year time period, will be significantly expensive. Please consider narrowing the time frame of your request.



Please simply respond to this request and let us know if you are willing to narrow/clarify the scope of your request in the manner suggested or in some other manner.  Please note that we may be required to send information to the Texas Attorney General for review prior to release.  That process could take 2-3 months.  TTUS is required to inform you that if you do not respond to this request for narrowing/clarification within 61 days from the date of this request, your request will be considered withdrawn.



Sincerely,

Brontë C. Staugaard

Assistant General Counsel

Texas Tech University System

(806) 742-2155



This communication, including any attachments, originates from an Attorney and may contain confidential information and is intended only for the individual or entity to whom it is addressed. Any review, dissemination, or copying of this communication by anyone other than the intended recipient is strictly prohibited. If you are not the intended recipient, please contact the sender by reply e-mail, delete and destroy all copies of the original message.

[cid:ecbcb271-a903-437d-9905-64caab2f0ac0]

To whom it may concern
Thank you for your reply. To narrow the scope, and make our request more specific and likely easier to fulfill, we would like to amend the request to the following:
The total number of academic dishonesty reports for TTU for each of the following years:
2021-22
2022-23
2023-24
2024-25
We do not need any student names, faculty names, department names, or college names, only the total number of dishonesty reports for each year. Thank you in advance for your help.
David May, Ph.D.
Professor
Department of Sociology
Mississippi State University

title: Traffic Stop Records

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Traffic Stop Records
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

all data, including statistical information, collected from any Massachusetts Uniform Citation (“MUC”) issued in the Commonwealth between January 1, 2020 and June 2025.

Some important fields may include:

City of Boston Employee ID (6 digit ID)
Badge Number
Employee first name
Employee middle name
Employee last name
Rank
Incident Number
District/Taskforce
Date of Stop
Time of Stop
Location of stop
Latitude/longitude
Race of driver
Gender of driver
Age of driver
If search occurred
If contraband was found

If any of these fields are unavailable, please reach out and let us know!

I also request a waiver of all fees for this request, as disclosure of the requested information to me is in the public interest and will contribute to the public’s understanding of operations and activities of the government. This request is being made for research conducted by Spark! at Boston University and will not be used for commercial use.

I expect the request to be filled in an electronically-accessible format, including for screen readers, excel, or CSV. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents. We understand that the data may be large in size, so feel free to send it over in year or half-year increments.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires. If you believe any of this information to be exempt, I ask you to please cite the specific portion of the law on which you rely. I also ask you to please redact any information you believe to be exempt and disclose the rest. If you need to discuss this request, I can be reached at 617-358-8514.

Sincerely,
Boston University SPARK!

communications.subject: Public Records Request (MassDOT) :: P001401-070225
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. University, 
 
Your public records request (see below) has been automatically entered, and assigned our Reference Number P001401-070225 for tracking purposes. Please note that your request is deemed received on the first business day after it has been entered in accordance with the Massachusetts Public Records Law; this is an automated response and does not mean it has been viewed by our department if received outside of non-business hours. To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

all data, including statistical information, collected from any Massachusetts Uniform Citation (“MUC”) issued in the Commonwealth between January 1, 2020 and June 2025.

Some important fields may include:

City of Boston Employee ID (6 digit ID)
Badge Number
Employee first name
Employee middle name
Employee last name
Rank
Incident Number
District/Taskforce
Date of Stop
Time of Stop
Location of stop
Latitude/longitude
Race of driver
Gender of driver
Age of driver
If search occurred
If contraband was found

If any of these fields are unavailable, please reach out and let us know!

I also request a waiver of all fees for this request, as disclosure of the requested information to me is in the public interest and will contribute to the public’s understanding of operations and activities of the government. This request is being made for research conducted by Spark! at Boston University and will not be used for commercial use.

I expect the request to be filled in an electronically-accessible format, including for screen readers, excel, or CSV. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents. We understand that the data may be large in size, so feel free to send it over in year or half-year increments.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires. If you believe any of this information to be exempt, I ask you to please cite the specific portion of the law on which you rely. I also ask you to please redact any information you believe to be exempt and disclose the rest. If you need to discuss this request, I can be reached at 617-358-8514.

Sincerely,
Boston University SPARK!

communications.subject: MassDOT RAO: Your request has been received
communications.communication:
Please note that MassDOT looks forward to providing you the information you seek under the public records law.

You may submit your public records requests in several ways:

By Online Portal:
Please visit the online portal<https://massachusettsdot.mycusthelp.com/WEBAPP/_rs/supporthome.aspx?lp=2&COID=64DA2B6806> and follow the directions. This new web portal will allow you to make requests, receive notifications, check the status and receive your records all from within a dedicated system. Like most web-based systems, you will initially have to create a user name and password, but that will only be a one-time requirement.

By Fax:
(857) 368-0615

By U.S. Mail, or In-Person:
Public Records Requests
MassDOT Office of the General Counsel
10 Park Plaza, Suite 3510
Boston, MA 02116

By Email:
If you would prefer to make your request by standard email, you may reply to this email with your request.

We look forward to assisting you with your public records request.

title: Third Party Investigative Platform (Purchase and Contract records) (Tacoma Police Department)

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Third Party Investigative Platform (Purchase and Contract records) (Tacoma Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the records listed below regarding the following four software programs: 

• Thompson Reuters Clear (https://legal.thomsonreuters.com/en/products/clear)
• LexisNexis Accurint (https://www.accurint.com/)
• TransUnion TLOxp, which may also be part of the TruLookup system (https://www.tlo.com/law-enforcement)
• SoundThinking CrimeTracer, which was formerly a product called COPLINK X (https://www.soundthinking.com/law-enforcement/crime-analysis-crimetracer/) from the company formerly known as ShotSpotter

For each of the above mentioned platforms, please provide the following records: 

• CONTRACTS AND AGREEMENTS —  All contracts (as well as associated amendments, attachments, and exhibits) and agreements related to the acquisition and use of these "software" programs.
• PURCHASE INFORMATION — All invoices and purchase information for costs and products associated with the above-referenced platforms.

Please provide responsive materials for the period from January 1, 2021 through the date this request is processed. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dave Maass

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Everett Public Schools District – Request for a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by the District including District Responses for the years 2010 - 2021
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act [RCW 42.56] I hereby request the following records:

I request a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by Everett Public Schools District and a complete electronic copy of the District's Responses to these Public Records Requests for the time period January 1, 2010 through November 4, 2021.

In the event the District chooses to provide these records in installments over time I request the records to be produced in reverse chronological order - from the most recent records to the earliest.

If this request is denied in whole or part, I ask that you justify all deletions by reference to specific exemptions of the PRA. I also request a detailed contemporaneous log to be provided for any document withheld or redacted.

For each responsive record the District contends is exempt from public disclosure, in whole or in part, please specifically identify the record by subject, title, author, custodian and date, and state how a specific statutory exemption applies to each record as required by RCW 42.56.210(3) and Rental Housing Ass'n v. Des Moines, 165 Wn.2d 525, 199 P.3d 393 (2009).

I request electronic production of all electronic records in the original NATIVE electronic format for each record. 

I request for these public records to be produced by public (no password) e-mail attachment or link. If electronic attachment or link is not possible, an alternative would be to produce responsive records via USB DRIVE or DATA CD-ROM.

THIS REQUEST IS NOT BEING MADE FOR COMMERCIAL PURPOSES.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

PRA Audit

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request: Everett Public Schools District – Request for a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by the District including District Responses for the years 2010 - 2021
communications.communication:
Dear PRA Audit,

I am the public records officer for Everett Public Schools and am writing in response to your request for records received on Friday, November 5, 2021. In that request you asked for “a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by Everett Public Schools District and a complete electronic copy of the District's Responses to these Public Records Requests for the time period January 1, 2010 through November 4, 2021.” Additionally, you requested that if installments are provided, that they should be produced in reverse chronological order, from most recent to the earliest, and requested electronic production of records in their native electronic format for each record. Lastly, you requested that records be provided by email attachments or electronic link and provided instructions for mailing any records being produced on a USB drive or CD. Thank you for confirming that your request is not for commercial purposes. A copy of your complete request can be located in the email string below.

In accordance with RCW 42.56.520<https://app.leg.wa.gov/rcw/default.aspx?cite=42.56.520>, I am acknowledging receipt of your request and providing notice that the district will require additional time to respond. This time is needed to seek any clarifications to the request, to locate and assemble the information requested, to potentially notify any affected third parties, and to review the records for any exempt information.

At this time, given the 11-year timeframe of this request, and until the full scope of the request is ascertained, we estimate that it will take several years to respond in full to this request. We anticipate providing an initial installment of records on or before January 7, 2022, providing monthly installments thereafter. The district is currently processing multiple requests for records, and, like yours, the size and scope of these requests vary in nature, and some of these requests are quite extensive and take a great deal of time to process. While we do our best to respond to requests as quickly as possible, we have limited staff and resources available to process these requests. At this time of the year especially, with the upcoming holidays and the closure of district facilities for the Thanksgiving and winter breaks, staff resources are even more limited.

As students are the nature of our business, many public records frequently include information about students. If any of the responsive documents contain student names or other identifying information (parent names, student ID numbers etc.), it is the typical practice of the district to redact those names when the requestor agrees to that practice. Please let us know if you have an objection to such redaction and the basis of your objection.

In addition, as part of our typical practice, if you do not review or claim your records within 30 days of a notification that an installment of records is ready for you, by indicating receipt of the records made available to you, or by indicating that you are unable to access the records made available to you, we will consider your request to be abandoned after 30 calendar days and close it at that time without further action.

We look forward to working with you for a satisfactory resolution to your request for public records. For reference, all the district’s policies and procedures for public records are available on our website at this page: https://everettsd.org/publicrecords.org.

Regards,




Sarah Mack
General Counsel
Superintendent's Office
SMack@everettsd.org<mailto:SMack@everettsd.org>
425-385-4123
[cid:image002.png@01D7D649.21D9FD90]<http://www.everettsd.org/site/default.aspx?PageID=1>

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request: Everett Public Schools District – Request for a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by the District including District Responses for the years 2010 - 2021
communications.communication:
Dear PRA Audit,

I am the public records officer for Everett Public Schools and am writing in response to your request for records received on Friday, November 5, 2021. In that request you asked for “a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by Everett Public Schools District and a complete electronic copy of the District's Responses to these Public Records Requests for the time period January 1, 2010 through November 4, 2021.” Additionally, you requested that if installments are provided, that they should be produced in reverse chronological order, from most recent to the earliest, and requested electronic production of records in their native electronic format for each record. Lastly, you requested that records be provided by email attachments or electronic link and provided instructions for mailing any records being produced on a USB drive or CD. Thank you for confirming that your request is not for commercial purposes. A copy of your complete request can be located in the email string below.

I am writing to let you know that we have an initial installment of records available for you. As requested, the records are being provided in reverse chronological order and represent 56 of the public records requests received in 2021, and the district responses to those requests. No new or additional redactions have been made to this particular installment of records, and the responsive records appear just as they did when provided to the original requester. A detailed redaction/exemption log, as it was provided to the original requester, is included with each request where applicable.

We noted that your preference was to receive the records as email attachments, however, the size of this initial installment is too large to be sent via email. Therefore, these records are being provided electronically via a shared file which you can access using the link below. As requested, this is a public link and is not password protected.

[​Folder icon] Public Records Request – MuckRock PRA Audit<https://epscloud-my.sharepoint.com/:f:/g/personal/09566_apps_everettsd_org/Etb5ZK1KDiVOp5A87K-hF5ABqFZVzMWPCVx55LVIpw5WxA?e=qYDwlM>

Please reply to this email to confirm receipt of the requested records, as the system will not notify us when you have accessed your records.

As part of our typical practice, if you do not review or claim your records within 30 days of this notification that an installment of records is ready for you, either by indicating receipt of the records made available to you or by indicating that you are unable to access the records made available to you, we will consider your request to be abandoned and close it at that time without further action. Accordingly, if we do not hear from you by February 7, 2022, your request will be deemed abandoned, the link to the files will no longer be available, and we will close your request at that time without any further action.

Please note that to “claim” or “review” records that are shared via an electronic link such as the one above, you must click the link and either download the files or click on the files to open them, and you must notify us that you have accessed the files or that you are unable to access the records made available to you no later than February 7, 2022. Again, if you fail to respond to this notification by that date, your request will be deemed abandoned, the link to the files will no longer be available, and we will close your request at that time without any further action.

With regard to the remainder of your request, we anticipate the next installment of records responsive to your request will be available on or before February 11, 2022.

Regards,




Sarah Mack
General Counsel
Superintendent's Office
SMack@everettsd.org<mailto:SMack@everettsd.org>
425-385-4123

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request: Everett Public Schools District – Request for a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by the District including District Responses for the years 2010 - 2021
communications.communication:
Dear PRA Audit,

I am the public records officer for Everett Public Schools and am writing in response to your request for records received on Friday, November 5, 2021. In that request you asked for “a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by Everett Public Schools District and a complete electronic copy of the District's Responses to these Public Records Requests for the time period January 1, 2010 through November 4, 2021.” Additionally, you requested that if installments are provided, that they should be produced in reverse chronological order, from most recent to the earliest, and requested electronic production of records in their native electronic format for each record. Lastly, you requested that records be provided by email attachments or electronic link and provided instructions for mailing any records being produced on a USB drive or CD. Thank you for confirming that your request is not for commercial purposes. A copy of your complete request can be located in the email string below.

I am writing to let you know that we have a second installment of records available for you. As requested, the records are being provided in reverse chronological order and represent an additional 36 of the public records requests received in 2021, and the district responses to those requests. A detailed redaction/exemption log, as it was provided to the original requester, is included with each request where applicable. New redactions are marked with a redaction code directly on the responsive records, and the explanation for those redactions can be found using the Redaction Code Log, which is provided with the installment. These redactions primarily include student names or other student/parent identifying information, or the redaction of staff personal information such as a personal email address or cell phone number. In addition, one record was withheld in its entirety as the record is a student education record and is protected from public disclosure (the original requester was the parent of the student whose education record it was). An Exemption Log for this record is also provided in this installment.

We noted that your preference was to receive the records as email attachments, however, the size of this installment is too large to be sent via email. Therefore, these records are being provided electronically via a shared file which you can access using the link below. As requested, this is a public link and is not password protected.

[​Folder icon] Public Records Request – MuckRock PRA Audit<https://epscloud-my.sharepoint.com/:f:/g/personal/09566_apps_everettsd_org/ErZyFIvyVTBNqV9mmDkx-sEBSOkFAxLiwaKniCabzzGOWw?e=9lNHuO>

The system will not notify us when you access your records. Please reply to this email to confirm receipt of the requested records.

As part of our typical practice, if you do not review or claim your records within 30 days of this notification that an installment of records is ready for you, we will consider your request to be abandoned and close it at that time without further action.

Please note that to “claim” or “review” records that are shared via an electronic link such as the one above, within 30 days you must:


  1.  click the link above; and
  2.  download or click on the files; and
  3.  notify us to indicate receipt of the records made available to you or to let us know that you are unable to access the records made available to you.

We have yet received a response from you verifying receipt of our last installment provided on January 7, 2022. We are providing an additional opportunity for you to respond to our notifications that an installment of records has been made available to you.

If you fail to respond to this notification by March 14, 2022, your request will be deemed abandoned, the link to the files will no longer be available, and we will close your request at that time without any further action.

With regard to the remainder of your request, as we have not heard from you since your original request was made and we have not received confirmation of your receipt of the January 7, 2022 installment, we have halted further work on this request until we receive confirmation of receipt of both installments provided to date. Upon such confirmation, the anticipated date for the next installment of records will be provided. Otherwise, your request will be deemed abandoned without further action as noted above.

Regards,




Sarah Mack
General Counsel
Superintendent's Office
SMack@everettsd.org<mailto:SMack@everettsd.org>
425-385-4123
